decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s): Site Location Plan; Existing Plans; Proposed Plans; Proposed Drawing No: 2.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| The maximum number of persons occupying the hereby approved House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) shall be limited to no more than seven (7) persons within seven (7) bedrooms.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development, in accordance with Policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the Council's HMO Licensing Guidelines. | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material and safeguard the appearance of the property and the amenities of the area, in accordance with Policies D4 and SI 8 of the London Plan (2021) and 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| Five (5) secured cycle parking spaces shall be implemented in in accordance with the submitted documentation and Council Policy and retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate cycle storage, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| No cooking facilities shall be installed at any time in any of the rooms. All cooking and preparation of hot food shall take place within the communal kitchens identified on the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the HMO rooms are not wholly self-contained and to protect the amenity of the occupants of each of the rooms and neighbouring properties, in accordance with Policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD and Council HMO Licensing Guidelines. | Prior to occupation, the house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall contain at least two (2) complete sets of cooking facilities and these shall be retained at all times.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy.
description: Change of use from 6 person House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) (Use Class C4) to a House in Multiple Occupation (Large HMO) for maximum 7 occupants (Use Class Sui Generis)
